plie package¶

Submodules¶

plie.helper_functions module¶

plie.helper_functions.array_insert(insertable, receives_insertion, offset=(2, 2), highlight=False, highlight_color='blue')[source]¶

inserts insertable into receives_insertion, where insertable is a string, and receives_insertion is an FSArray

array_insert will insert insertables bigger than receives_insertion can handle

Parameters:
  • insertable – a string to insert
  • receives_insertion – an FSArray to
  • offset – distance from top left to start insertion. (x,y) format because that’s the only reasonable way
  • highlight – changes the coloring of the char to insert, used to make text look highlighted
  • highlight_color – sets the color for showing the highlight, see curtsies foreground color choices for a list of possible options

Notes

Goes character by character through insertable to add them one at a time to receives_insertion since that gets around the complication of making slice sizes with the length of strings trying to be inserted.

plie.helper_functions.borderer(array=None, width=40, height=30)[source]¶

Give it height and width, and it’ll give you a bordered box as a FSArray.

borderer consumes the outermost cell for border drawing.

Parameters:
  • array – FSArray to surround with a border
  • width – of the border
  • height – of the border

Returns: FSArray with a border surrounding it

plie.helper_functions.fit_text(text, array, margin=1, justification='left', vertical_position='top')[source]¶

Fit and flow text into an array, splits words to newlines at spaces.

Parameters:
  • text – The text to fill the array with. Can include special characters, newlines and spaces.
  • array – The FSArray to put the text into.
  • margin – Amount of space to leave around the text in cells
  • justification – acceptable options are ‘left’, ‘right’ and ‘center’
  • vertical_position – acceptable options are ‘top’, ‘center’, and ‘bottom’

Returns: an FSArray with the text filling the interior.

plie.plie module¶

class plie.plie.TitleBar(array, text='Title', offset=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

A context manager to add a title to the top of a FSArray

text¶
plie.plie.border(array)[source]¶

Context manager to put a border around any array. Uses the outermost cell of the array on all sides to create the border, so if there is content there it will get overwritten.

array: an FSArray to have a border made around it

plie.plie.simple_title(array, text='Title', offset=0)[source]¶

Adds a title bar to the top of an FSArray.

array: an FSArray to have the title added to text: the text which gets used as a title, can be multiple lines offset: the offset in cells from the top to place the title (0 would overlap a border)
